output.conclusion: This course provides a foundational understanding of community medicine, equipping you with the knowledge to contribute to public health initiatives and address health disparities in your community.
output.introduction: Welcome to the Introduction to Community Medicine! This course will provide you with a basic understanding of the principles and practices of community medicine, focusing on public health, disease prevention, and health promotion at the community level.

chapters.description: An overview of the definition, scope, and importance of community medicine. Discuss the differences between clinical medicine and community medicine.
Explore the core principles such as population health, social determinants of health, and health equity. Examples of how these principles are applied in practice.

chapters.chapterTitle: The Role of Community Medicine in Public Health
chapters.description: Examine the relationship between community medicine and public health. Discuss the functions of public health and how community medicine contributes to these functions.
Learn about methods for assessing the health needs of a community, including data collection and analysis.
Explore the steps involved in planning effective community health programs, including setting goals, objectives, and strategies.
Discuss the practical aspects of implementing community health programs and evaluating their effectiveness.

modules.moduleTitle: Community Health Assessment and Program Planning

chapters.description: Overview of various health promotion strategies, including education, advocacy, and social marketing.
Explore different levels of disease prevention (primary, secondary, tertiary) and examples of each.
Discuss the concept of health disparities and strategies for reducing inequalities in health outcomes.
